info: The proposed loan for the second DPSP (DPSP-2), which is subprogram 1 of the proposed program cluster, building on the support provided through the first DPSP approved by the Asian Development Bank (ADB) in December 2005. The DPSP series—cofinancing the Development Policy Loan (DPL) series supported by the World Bank and the Government of Japan—is embedded in the Government’s Medium-Term Development Plan (RPJM) for 2004–2009. It supports the broad goal of the RPJM to stimulate higher and sustainable economic growth (to 7% average annual growth by 2009 from around 4% prior to 2004) and halve poverty (from 16.6% in 2004 to 8.2% by 2009). To achieve these goals, DPSP-2 supports wide-ranging reforms in four core areas to (i) improve macroeconomic stability and creditworthiness, (ii) promote investments, (iii) strengthen the public financial management and anticorruption framework, and (iv) improve the delivery of public services. DPSP-2 is proposed as a single tranche operation based on a range of up-front actions taken by the Government in the core areas.
name: SECOND DEVT POLICY SUPPORT PROGRAM CLUSTER-SUBPROGRAM I
